definition[0]: to make someone move quickly, especially by pushing them roughly
example[0]: I was hustled out of the building by a couple of security men.
note[0]: hustle somebody into/out of/through etc something
example[1]: He was hustled away by police officers.
definition[1]: to do something with a lot of energy and determination
example[2]: Cindy’s not a great player, but she really hustles.
definition[2]: to hurry in doing something or going somewhere
example[3]: We need to hustle if we’re going to make this flight.
definition[3]: to sell or obtain things in an illegal or dishonest way
example[4]: thieves hustling stolen goods on the street
definition[4]: to work as a prostitute, or to be in charge of prostitutes
example[5]: the hustle and bustle of the market place
definition[6]: ways of getting money that involve cheating or deceiving people
definition[7]: when someone does something quickly, with a lot of effort and eagerness
example[6]: The team has a lot of talent but no hustle.
